intro: Alepyrum muticum, commonly known as the yellow sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette of fleshy, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer, typically in clusters at the ends of its stems. Alepyrum muticum thrives in well-drained, rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine ecosystems.
